Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Model-Based RSA for Cementless Tapered Wedge Femoral Stem

Trial_Design.evidence: participants were randomly assigned to either model-based RSA or marker-based RSA

Participants.evidence: participants were patients undergoing THA with cementless tapered wedge femoral stems. The trial was conducted at a single orthopedic center.

Intervention.evidence: participants were randomly assigned to either model-based RSA or marker-based RSA

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the accuracy of RSA measurements

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: using computer-generated random numbers, with allocation concealment ensured by sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 24 patients were randomised, with 12 in each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The accuracy of model-based RSA was 0.03 mm for subsidence and 0.39° for rotation, while marker-based RSA showed 0.06 mm and 0.18°, respectively.
